lines.speaker: 2nd
lines.text: I like steadiness; security lets me breathe.

lines.speaker: 6th
lines.text: And yet, routine dulls my craft.

lines.speaker: 2nd
lines.text: But what is craft without the foundation to sustain it?

lines.speaker: 6th
lines.text: Perhaps the craft itself becomes the foundation.

lines.speaker: system
lines.text: When has security started to feel like boredom for you?

lines.speaker: 2nd
lines.text: I measure value in what endures.

lines.speaker: 10th
lines.text: I measure value in what others see.

lines.speaker: 2nd
lines.text: But what if what endures is invisible?

lines.speaker: 10th
lines.text: Then it must be made visible. That is my work.

lines.speaker: system
lines.text: Where do you feel the tension between inner worth and outer recognition?

lines.speaker: 2nd
lines.text: I hold what is mine, carefully.

lines.speaker: 8th
lines.text: I invite you to release what no longer serves.

lines.speaker: 8th
lines.text: Loss is transformation. What you release becomes something else.

lines.speaker: system
lines.text: What are you holding onto that might be ready to transform?
